Expectation1: Secure packages and confirm successful delivery
Situation1: Leaving a package safely at the doorstep when no one is home
Expectation2: Live according to Christian moral values and ethics
Situation2: They face a serious situation that directly tests their commitment to Christian morals
Story: I pulled up to the small, tidy house at the end of the cul-de-sac, a package in hand. The instructions were clear: leave the box at the doorstep and snap a photo for proof. No one answered when I rang the bell, so I set the package down, ready to move on. But as I turned to leave, I noticed the door was slightly ajar. Through the crack, I could see a wallet lying just inside, bills peeking out. My job was to secure the delivery, not get involved. But as a Christian, I felt a tug in my heart—what if someone took advantage of this open door? What if the homeowner was in trouble? I stood there, torn between the company’s rule to never enter a customer’s home and my own conviction to help and protect others. My phone buzzed with the next delivery, but I couldn’t ignore the uneasy feeling growing inside me.
